embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/lJL2asANiyM&hl=en&fs=1"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/lJL2asANiyM&hl=en&fs=1" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
With nearly 1.5 million downloads per month, the CPython installers for
Windows account for a huge amount of the traffic through python.org, and
they're the most common way for Windows users to obtain Python. Take a look at
what's going on with Python on Windows and see what the road ahead looks like
for Python 3.3.
title: What's New in Python on Windows
